intro: Chaerophyllum nitens, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and woodland edges. Chaerophyllum nitens is a perennial herb that is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
